text:
Is there a tutorial for BioJulia? I want to see how much from the bioinformatics class I'm taking that I can do in it.

My first thought was "Can I ask it to load one or more GenBank sequences?" But I'm not seeing anything, not even sure which package it would be in.

I'd be happy to document my exploration and compile a tutorial based on it.

elements.text:
Is there a tutorial for BioJulia? I want to see how much from the bioinformatics class I'm taking that I can do in it.

My first thought was "Can I ask it to load one or more GenBank sequences?" But I'm not seeing anything, not even sure which package it would be in.

I'd be happy to document my exploration and compile a tutorial based on it.

text:
That would be helpful! There's a genbank parser made by someone, but it's not in biojulia. Building one is one of the oldest items on my julia to-do list :man-facepalming:

We've had discussions in the past about making a biojulia cookbook, but people have been too busy developing to get that set up

elements.text: That would be helpful! There's a genbank parser made by someone, but it's not in biojulia. Building one is one of the oldest items on my julia to-do list
We've had discussions in the past about making a biojulia cookbook, but people have been too busy developing to get that set up

text: Gotcha! Well in the meantime I'm throwing together a package to fetch sequences by accession number. I'll generalize it from here. Figured out how to request FASTA from NCBI databases which is good enough to start. <https://github.com/BioTurboNick/BioFetch.jl/blob/main/src/BioFetch.jl>

elements.text: Gotcha! Well in the meantime I'm throwing together a package to fetch sequences by accession number. I'll generalize it from here. Figured out how to request FASTA from NCBI databases which is good enough to start.

text:
That would be awesome! I think it will be hard to have an "official" tutorial for all things BioJulia, because there is a flux of packages and versions in the ecosystem.
Perhaps a tutorial on BioSymbols + BioSequences + FASTX + BioFetch would be useful

elements.text:
That would be awesome! I think it will be hard to have an "official" tutorial for all things BioJulia, because there is a flux of packages and versions in the ecosystem.
Perhaps a tutorial on BioSymbols + BioSequences + FASTX + BioFetch would be useful

text: I have a package for parsing GenBank files, but as mentioned it isn’t in BioJulia. Perhaps I ought to do something about that. <https://github.com/kdyrhage/GenomicAnnotations.jl>

elements.text: I have a package for parsing GenBank files, but as mentioned it isn’t in BioJulia. Perhaps I ought to do something about that.

text:
<@U01HD5VFXJM> did you see BioServices.jl? That's got some utilities for interacting with NCBI - would it make sense to put some of the BioFetch code there? <https://github.com/BioJulia/BioServices.jl|https://github.com/BioJulia/BioServices.jl>

<@U01JE9F1NER> ah, yeah that's what I was looking for. I'd like to make one using Automa.jl, but I've used yours and it worked well.

elements.text: did you see BioServices.jl? That's got some utilities for interacting with NCBI - would it make sense to put some of the BioFetch code there?
ah, yeah that's what I was looking for. I'd like to make one using Automa.jl, but I've used yours and it worked well.
